item.title: Strong blast at Havana hotel kills 8 people, injures 40
item.description: A powerful explosion apparently caused by a natural gas leak Friday killed eight people and injured at least 40 when it blew away outer walls from a five-star hotel in the heart of Cuba's capital.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Rooms are exposed at the five-star Hotel Saratoga where emergency crew work after a deadly explosion in Old Havana, Cuba, Friday, May 6, 2022. (AP Photo/Ramon Espinosa)

item.title: Jill Biden visits Europe, will meet with Ukrainian refugees
item.description: Delivering good cheer -- and 5 gallons of ketchup -- Jill Biden thanked U.S. troops deployed to Romania as a check against Russian aggression for their service, as she began a four-day trip to Europe to see first hand the refugee crisis caused by Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: U.S. First Lady Jill Biden meets U.S. troops during a visit to the Mihail Kogalniceanu Air Base in Romania, Friday, May 6, 2022. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh, Pool)

item.title: Ukraine updates: Ukraine warns more shelling amid Russia's Victory Day
item.description: What's happening in Ukraine on Friday: Officials from Ukraine's national security council warned residents Friday against the increased risk of shelling on Sunday and Monday, coinciding with Russia's Victory Day celebrations.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: A view of an apartment building destroyed by night shelling in Kramatorsk, Ukraine, Thursday, May 5, 2022. (AP Photo/Andriy Andriyenko)

item.title: Andrew, Harry and Meghan won't appear on jubilee balcony
item.description: Buckingham Palace on Friday answered the biggest remaining questions about Queen Elizabeth II's Platinum Jubilee celebrations: Prince Andrew, Prince Harry and Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, won't be on the palace balcony when the monarch greets the public on June 2.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Andrew, Meghan the Duchess of Sussex and Prince Harry stand on a balcony at Buckingham Palace in London, on July 10, 2018. (Matt Dunham / AP)

item.title: Woman forced to land in Belarus gets 6 years in prison
item.description: A woman who ran a Belarusian opposition messaging app channel and was arrested along with her activist boyfriend when an airliner they were on was forced to land in Belarus was convicted Friday of charges that included inciting social hatred.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Sofia Sapega waiting for a court hearing in Grodno, Belarus, on May 6, 2022. (Leonid Shcheglov / Pool via AP)

item.title: Sri Lanka leader declares emergency amid protests
item.description: Sri Lanka's president declared a state of emergency on Friday amid widespread public protests demanding his resignation over the country's worst economic crisis recent memory.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Protesters demanding the resignation of the government in Colombo, Sri Lanka, on May 6, 2022. (Eranga Jayawardena / AP)

item.title: Cocaine in Nespresso coffee beans intercepted by Swiss police
item.description: Swiss police say an investigation is underway after workers at a Nespresso factory in western Switzerland found 500 kilograms (over 1,100 pounds) of cocaine, with a street value of US$50 million, as they unloaded coffee beans that had arrived by train.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Police photo of a shipment containing cocaine seized in the Swiss town of Romont. (Fribourg cantonal police via AP)

item.title: Israel searches for attackers who killed 3 in mass stabbing
item.description: Israeli security forces took part in a massive manhunt Friday for two Palestinians suspected of carrying out a stabbing rampage near Tel Aviv that left three Israelis dead.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Israeli police investigate at the scene of a stabbing attack in Elad, Israel, on May 5, 2022. (Maya Alleruzzo / AP)

item.title: U.K. Conservatives lose London strongholds, in blow to Johnson
item.description: Britain's governing Conservatives suffered local election losses in their few London strongholds, according to results announced Friday that will pile more pressure on Prime Minister Boris Johnson amid ethics scandals and a worsening economic picture.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Ballot boxes are opened at the Glasgow City Council election count in Glasgow, Scotland, on May 6, 2022. (Jane Barlow / PA via AP)

item.title: U.S. gave intel before Ukraine sank Russian warship, official says
item.description: The U.S. says it shared intelligence with Ukraine about the location of the Russian missile cruiser Moskva before the strike that sank the warship, a high-profile embarrassment for Russia's military, but the Pentagon denied Friday that it played a direct role in the strike.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Russia's Black Sea Fleet flagship, missile cruiser Moskva, anchored in Sevastopol, on Sept. 11, 2008. (AP)
